Neocortex.name: Hay et al. 2011
Neocortex.description: Layer 5b pyramidal cell constrained by experimental data on perisomatic firing properties as well as dendritic activity during backpropagation of the action potential.

Neocortex.name: Smith et al. 2013
Neocortex.extra_link_text: View Figure 6A from OSB paper in 3D
Neocortex.description: Multicompartmental model of Layer 2/3 pyramidal cell used for investigating dendritic spiking

Neocortex.name: Allen Institute Cell Types DB
Neocortex.extra_link_text: View Figure 3A from OSB paper in 3D (slow to load)
Neocortex.description: Conversion of cell models and data to NeuroML from Allen CellTypes Database

Neocortex.name: Markram et al. 2015
Neocortex.extra_link_text: View Figure 3B from OSB paper in 3D
Neocortex.description: A project to illustrate how models and data from the Blue Brain Project can be converted to NeuroML and PyNN

Neocortex.name: Pospischil et al. 2008
Neocortex.description: Minimal Hodgkin-Huxley type models for different classes of cortical and thalamic neurons

Neocortex.name: Sadeh et al. 2017
Neocortex.extra_link_text: View Figure 7B from OSB paper in 3D
Neocortex.description: Models of Inhibition Stabilized Networks in mammalian neocortex

Neocortex.name: Multiscale ISN
Neocortex.extra_link_text: View Figure 7D from OSB paper in 3D
Neocortex.description: Inhibition Stabilized Network featuring point neurons providing input to detailed L2/3 pyramidal cells

Neocortex.name: Traub et al. 2005
Neocortex.description: Single-column thalamocortical network model with 14 multicompartmental cell populations

Neocortex.name: Potjans & Diesmann 2014
Neocortex.description: Microcircuit model of early sensory cortex displaying asynchronous irregular activity with layer-specific firing rates

Neocortex.name: Brunel 2000
Neocortex.description: Sparsely connected spiking neuron network from Brunel 2000

Neocortex.name: Izhikevich spiking neuron model
Neocortex.description: Spiking neuron model originally described in Izhikevich 2003, which can reproduce a range of firing behaviors

Neocortex.name: M1 Network model
Neocortex.description: A multiscale model of mouse primary motor cortex (M1).

Cerebellum.name: Maex and De Schutter 1998
Cerebellum.description: Granule Cell Layer network model with single compartment, conductance based cells

Cerebellum.name: Vervaeke et al. 2010
Cerebellum.extra_link_text: View Figure 3C from OSB paper in 3D
Cerebellum.description: A network model of electrically coupled cerebellar Golgi cells, as described in Vervaeke et al. 2010

Cerebellum.name: Solinas et al. 2007
Cerebellum.description: Multicompartmental cerebellar Golgi cell model demonstrating ionic currents underlying pacemaking and electroresponsiveness of these cells

Cerebellum.name: Cayco-Gajic, Clopath, Silver 2017
Cerebellum.description: Model of cerebellar granule cell layer used to investigate how sparse synaptic connectivity influences pattern separation.

Hippocampus.name: Migliore et al. 2005
Hippocampus.description: Morphologically detailed model of CA1 Pyramidal cell

Hippocampus.name: Wang & Buzsáki 1996
Hippocampus.description: Gamma oscillation by synaptic inhibition in a hippocampal interneuronal network model

Hippocampus.name: Ferguson el al. 2013
Hippocampus.description: A two-variable simple model derived from patch-clamp recordings from the CA1 region of a whole hippocampus preparation of PV+ fast-firing cells

Hippocampus.name: Pinsky and Rinzel 1994
Hippocampus.description: A 2-compartment (soma and dendrite), conductance-based (Hodgin-Huxley type) model of a hippocampal CA3 pyramidal neuron

Hippocampus.name: Bezaire el al. 2016
Hippocampus.extra_link_text: View Figure 4I from OSB paper in 3D (slow to load)
Hippocampus.description: A large-scale, detailed, biologically constrained network model of the rodent hippocampal CA1 area

Olfactory bulb.name: Migliore et al. 2014
Olfactory bulb.extra_link_text: View Figure 6B from OSB paper in 3D
Olfactory bulb.description: Migliore et al. (2014) 3D Model of the Olfactory Bulb

Invertebrate models.name: Hodgkin and Huxley 1952
Invertebrate models.description: A tutorial designed to give an overview of the Hodgkin-Huxley model

Invertebrate models.name: Boyle & Cohen 2008
Invertebrate models.description: A NeuroML 2 implementation of the C. elegans muscle cell model of Boyle & Cohen 2008, as used in the OpenWorm project.

Invertebrate models.name: Prinz et al. 2004
Invertebrate models.description: Implementation of the pyloric network of the lobster stomatogastric ganglion system of Prinz, Marder, et al.

Invertebrate models.name: Fitzhugh Nagumo model
Invertebrate models.description: The Fitzhugh Nagumo model is a two-dimensional simplification of the Hodgkin-Huxley model of spike generation in squid giant axons.

Neuronal reconstructions.name: NeuroMorpho.Org
Neuronal reconstructions.description: Set of example reconstructed neuronal morphologies taken from NeuroMorpho.Org in NeuroML format.

Neuronal reconstructions.name: Janelia MouseLight
Neuronal reconstructions.description: Showcase project on OSB for neuronal reconstructions from the Janelia MouseLight project.
